DispatchHealth operates as a two-sided marketplace in which we leverage our technology to match our providers most effectively with patients in need of care. This role will focus on capacity and demand forecasting and matching activities associated with DispatchHealth markets, leveraging the most advanced modeling techniques, while incorporating business intelligence and forecast information gathered from growth, marketing, finance, and market operations teams. Specifically, this includes intraday modeling, short-term and long-term capacity/demand modeling, and mitigation of business seasonality, utilizing machine learning models that inform those decisions balancing supply and demand. The forecasting and data analysis performed in these areas amount to the decision-making processes that informs how we hire, manage staff, and control market operating costs so that we see the right patients, at the right time, with the right providers, and with the right level of care. This process is central to our driving industry-leading medical cost savings, amazing clinical outcomes, and an incredible patient and provider experience. As such, this role will have tremendous impact and influence. This position will also be responsible for managing other Data Analysts and Data Scientists to produce impacts in the areas of forecasting, market operations, and general business operations. The development of actionable reporting and business explainability via data analytics is critical to driving operational improvements, as well as moving the needle on key performance indicators and company initiatives. This role will collaborate closely with our tech organization in order to make use of and build upon our existing data platform and to tailor our forecasts and related model outputs for use in a range of automated, production-level products and systems.Primary Responsibilities:Manage and lead a team of Data Analysts and Data Scientists responsible for forecasting and data analytics. Develop the models and algorithms to forecast capacity and demand across all service lines and across all relevant timeframes, including intraday, daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and yearly. Develop key data-driven insights and reports which identify key areas for operational improvement across the organization, and work with operational leaders to turn those insights into action. Collaborate with teams across finance, growth, operations, clinical, and tech to share projects and develop the relevant action plans based upon them. This includes informing both short-term and long-term capacity planning to align with demand projections – e.g., creating shift schedules, creating hiring targets. Regularly manage forums with teams in markets across the country as well as with Senior and Executive management to share and iterate on our capacity and demand projections and plans. Create and execute department road maps that achieve business goals and align with overall strategy. Continually improve our forecasting performance and capabilities through statistical methods, by collaborating with teams across the company to understand forecast drivers Ensure proper documentation of all forecasting and analytical processes, including methods, models, and tools utilized.Qualifications:12+ years of experience in a demand planning/forecasting role. Direct experience working with Looker, Python, Sequel, and business intelligence tools. Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel to analyze data and perform statistical modeling techniques. Demonstrated knowledge of demand planning philosophies and processes with proven track record of success. Strong mathematical and statistical knowledge. Demonstrate excellent analytical skills with a strategic ability. Ability to thrive in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment with focus on hands-on execution. Strong and collaborative work ethic, working effectively as part of a larger operations team.Ability to make sound business judgment and strong decision-making skills; ability to identify, prioritize, and articulate highest impact initiatives.Meticulous organizational skills, analytic capabilities, and attention to detail to facilitate a close relationship with key Operations and Finance teams.Excellent communication skills, with ability to present complex ideas in a clear, concise fashion to technical and non-technical audiences.Ability to work independently, self-motivated.Prior experience managing 5+ direct reports preferred.BA/BS in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Technology, Economics, InformationSystems, Statistics, Applied Math, or another related field.Healthcare experience a plus.
